sentences.en: ...seven years after the Roman invasion of Britain.
sentences.cn: …罗马人入侵大不列颠岛之后的7年。
对个人隐私的非法侵犯

sentences.en: He leaned towards her and she stiffened at this invasion of her personal space.
sentences.cn: 他向她俯过身去，这种侵犯她个人空间的举动让她绷紧了身子。

sentences.en: I felt my body involuntarily stiffen against her invasion of my personal space.
sentences.cn: 随着她不断侵入我的个人空间，我感觉全身都不由自主地紧绷起来。

sentences.en: Seaside resorts such as Blackpool and Brighton are preparing for a tourist invasion.
sentences.cn: 像布莱克浦与布赖顿这样的海滨胜地正为游客的大批涌入做准备。

sentences.en: the annual invasion of teenagers for the Glastonbury Festival
sentences.cn: 每年前来参加格拉斯顿伯里音乐节的青少年的涌入

sentences.en: the German invasion of Poland in 1939
sentences.cn: 德国于1939年对波兰的侵略

sentences.en: The invasion of tourists brought life to the summer resort.
sentences.cn: 大批游客涌入,使这个避暑胜地热闹起来.

sentences.en: The invasion was held up by unexpectedly stout resistance.
sentences.cn: 入侵行动因遭遇到了出乎意料的顽强抵抗而受阻。

sentences.en: The secrecy and swiftness of the invasion shocked and amazed army officers.
sentences.cn: 这次入侵的隐秘和迅速令陆军军官们大为震惊。

sentences.en: There was a peaceful pitch invasion after Milan's eighth goal.
sentences.cn: 米兰队攻入第八粒进球后，观众有序地涌进球场。

sentences.en: They all trembled at the prospect of an enemy invasion.
sentences.cn: 他们想到敌人可能入侵都不寒而栗.

sentences.en: They are ready against the possible invasion.
They received intelligence of an impending invasion.
sentences.cn: 他们收到消息,说侵略就在眼前.

sentences.en: This invasion is tantamount to a declaration of war.
sentences.cn: 这次侵略就相当于宣战.

sentences.en: This was a shocking invasion of privacy.
sentences.cn: 这是对隐私的公然侵犯。

phrases.tran_cn: 侵犯个人隐私；侵犯隐私权

trans.tran_cn: 入侵，侵略，侵害，侵犯，侵袭，[医]发病
trans.tran_en: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it
